main event: On December 29, 1964, two silver metallic objects were observed in Glen Falls, New York, identified as a balloon.
interesting points: The objects appeared to be pressed together, rather than singular,The objects had a slow speed estimated at 20 mph and were seen at about 500-600 feet elevation,The sighting included intermittent disappearance and reappearance of the objects,The diameter of the objects was estimated to be 10-15 inches,The objects made no sound during the observation.
witness description: Details provided for the sighting were from observers during investigation.
